children.name: to officially tell sb to do sth
order
children.definition: to tell sb that they must do sth, especially using your official power or authority : ra lệnh
examples: Only the king has the power to order her release from prison.
After the accident the government ordered a full public enquiry.

children.name: order sb to do sth
examples: The colonel ordered his men to advance.
He was ordered to pay a total of £65 compensation.

children.name: order that
examples: The court ordered that Gilmore should be executed.

children.name: order sb into/out of/back etc
examples: It wasn’t until 1973 that Nixon finally ordered US troops out of Vietnam.
The soldiers were ordered back to their units.

children.name: instruct
children.definition: formal to officially tell someone to do something, especially when you tell them exactly how it should be done:
examples: instruct sb to do sth
▪ It is a good idea to instruct a specialist company to inspect the property for damp.
▪ One of the secretaries had been instructed to reserve me a seat on the next plane to London.
as instructedin the way that you have been instructed
▪ She took the tablets three times every day, as instructed by her doctor.
instructverbORDER
[ T + to infinitive] to order or tell someone to do something, especially in a formal way
_The police have been instructedtopatrol the building and surrounding area.

children.name: give orders
children.definition: /instructions if someone such as a leader or officer gives orders or gives instructions, they tell other people exactly what they must do:
examples: ra chỉ thị
give orders/instructions to do sth
▪ It was the police chief who had given orders to shoot.
give orders/instructions that ra chỉ thị rằng
▪ The doctor left after giving instructions that she should rest as much as possible.
give somebody orders/instructions ra chỉ thị cho ai đó
▪ The General has given them orders to bomb the city.
give (somebody) strict instructions ra chỉ thị cho ai đó một cách nghiêm khắc
▪ We were given strict instructions that nobody should be allowed in the building without a security card.

children.name: issue orders
children.definition: /instructions/ˌɪʃuː ˈɔːʳdəʳz, ɪnˈstrʌkʃənz/  if someone such as a leader or officer issues orders or issues instructions, they tell people exactly what they should do, especially by sending a written statement:

children.name: ban hành lệnh
examples: ▪ The EC plans to issue orders banning the sale of the drug.

children.name: issue orders/instructions that
examples: ▪ The Department of Defense has issued instructions that no one should enter the area without permission.

children.name: decree
children.definition: /dɪˈkriː/  if a government, parliament, or court decrees that something should happen, they officially order it by making a law or by changing the existing law: ra sắc lệnh, ra chiếu chỉ
examples: ▪ The government decreed a ban on all contact with the guerrillas by local and provincial government officials.

children.name: decree (that)
examples: ▪ In 1929 Parliament decreed that all women should have the right to vote.

children.name: command
children.definition: /kəˈmɑːndǁkəˈmænd/  if a high-ranking person such as a general, captain, or king etc commands sb to do sth, they tell them officially that they must do it: hạ lệnh

children.name: command somebody to do sth
examples: ▪ Admiral Boyle commanded the entire crew to assemble on deck.

children.name: command that
examples: ▪ The King had the power to command that parliament be dissolved.

children.name: direct
children.definition: sb to do sth if someone in a position of legal authority such as a judge directs sb to do sth, they order them to do it: chỉ thị trực tiếp ai đó làm gì
examples: ▪ The judge directed the jury to find her not guilty.
▪ He was jailed for refusing to answer questions when directed to do so in court.

children.name: enjoying telling people what to do
bossy
children.definition: disapproving always telling people what to do, especially when you have no authority to do so: hống hách, hách dịch
examples: She found Molly to be bossy and interfering.
‘You can’t wear that hat,’ said Monica in her usual bossy voice.

children.name: dictatorial
children.definition: /ˌdɪktəˈtɔːriəl◂/  someone who is dictatorialuses their power in an unreasonable way by always telling people what to do or what is correct, and ignoring their wishes or views: độc tài, độc đoán
examples: ▪ His attitude has become increasingly dictatorial.
▪ The Ministry of Trade was yesterday accused of being dictatorial in its plans for a new motorway in Kent.

children.name: officious
children.definition: /əˈfɪʃəs/  someone who is officious, especially an unimportant official, is too eager to tell people what they must do and pays too much attention to unimportant rules
examples: ▪ The people at the tax department were very officious, and kept everyone waiting for hours while they checked their papers.
▪ I got held up by an officious receptionist who wouldn’t let me in until I’d answered all her questions.

children.name: overbearing
children.definition: /ˌəʊvəʳˈbeərɪŋ/  sb who is overbearing has an unpleasant and threatening manner, as if they want to control you and expect to be obeyed, and refuses to listen to other people’s opinions and arguments: hách dịch, hống hách
examples: ▪ The manager can be very overbearing at times, and it’s difficult to argue with him.
▪ His wife felt stifled in the presence of her overbearing mother-in-law.

children.name: a statement telling sb to do sth
order
children.definition: an official statement ordering you to do something, given by someone with the power to do this, especially a military officer: mệnh lệnh

children.name: give/issue an order
examples: Do not fire until I give the order.

children.name: obey an order
examples: He refused to obey this order.

children.name: follow orders/carry out orders
children.definition: obey them
examples: The men argued that they had only been following orders.

children.name: take orders from somebody
children.definition: be given orders by them and obey them
examples: I don’t take orders from you!

children.name: disobey/ignore an order
examples: Anyone who disobeys these orders will be severely punished.

children.name: have orders to do something
examples: The soldiers had orders to shoot anyone on the streets after 10 o'clock.

children.name: receive an order
examples: The general says he received no order to withdraw.

children.name: make an order
children.definition: used of a court
examples: The court made an adoption order.

children.name: a direct order
children.definition: a clear order
examples: What happens to a soldier who disobeys a direct order?

children.name: strict orders
examples: They had strict orders not to allow anyone through.

children.name: a court order
children.definition: when a judge in a court says you must do something
examples: Now they’re faced with a court order that could force them to leave.

children.name: an executive order
children.definition: an order from a president
examples: President Grant issued an executive order establishing a reservation for the Nex Perce Indians.

children.name: doctor’s orders
children.definition: when the doctor says you must do something
examples: She was to rest as much as possible on doctor’s orders.

children.name: that’s an orderused to tell someone that they must definitely do something đó là mệnh lệnh
examples: You will report to me at eight o'clock in the morning -- and that’s an order.

children.name: order to do sth
examples: The captain had to give the order to abandon ship.

children.name: sb’s ordersthe orders someone has been given những mệnh lệnh của ai
examples: My orders are to take you to the airport and put you on the first plane to Paris.

children.name: on sb’s orders
examples: He was thrown into the river on the emperor’s orders.

children.name: by order of sb
examples: The company cannot be identified by order of the court.

children.name: under orders (from sb) (to do sth)
examples: She is under orders to have a complete rest.

children.name: instruction
children.definition: a statement telling sb what they must do, usually giving them details of how they should do it: chỉ thị
examples: My instructions were to give the package to him personally.
My instructions are(= I have been told )to give the package to him personally.
Mr Patel’s instructions are to phone him immediately if you get any news from the police.

children.name: be under instruction to do sth
children.definition: to have been told to do something

children.name: on sb’s instructions
children.definition: having been told by someone to do something

children.name: instructions to do sth
examples: Scott has just received instructions to return to Washington.

children.name: instructions on
examples: We were given instructions on what to do in an emergency.

children.name: instructions that
examples: Mrs Edwards left instructions that in the event of her death the money was to be shared between her sons.

children.name: detailed/specific/strict instructions
examples: The boss won’t be here tomorrow, but she’s left you detailed instructions so you’ll know exactly what to do.
Sometimes my mother visits me at work, although I have given her strict instructions not to do so.
He had specific instructions to check everyone’s identity cards.

children.name: follow/obey/carry out instructions
examples: If you’d followed my instructions carefully none of this would have happened.
Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions .

children.name: give instructions
examples: Mrs Edwards gave instructions that she was not to be disturbed.
The police were under instruction to fire if necessary.
On the landlord’s instructions, the barmaid refused to serve him.
The police who broke into the house were only acting on/under instructions.

children.name: command
children.definition: an official order by someone such as a king or a military officer which must be obeyed: mệnh lệnh
examples: An officer stood on one of the tanks and began shouting commands through a loudspeaker.
You will run forwardat(= when you hear) my command.
Shoot when I give the command .
give the command to do sth
Admiral Collingwood gave the command to open fire.
obey/disobey a command
Your dog will soon learn to obey your commands
If any of the King’s subjects refused to obey one of his commands, they were put to death.
shout a commandKruger shouted his commands: 'Faster, faster!'

children.name: give a command
children.definition: alsoissue a commandformal
examples: The General gave the command to open fire.

children.name: carry out a command
children.definition: obey one
examples: The men carried out the command immediately.

children.name: bark a command
children.definition: shout one rather rudely
examples: She just stands there barking commands while everyone works.

children.name: directive
children.definition: an official order which is made by a powerful organization and has the effect of a law: chỉ thị
examples: Article 10 of the directive requires all food to be clearly labelled.
directive on/ about
proposals forimplementingthe EUdirectiveon paternity leave
The boss issued a directive about not using the fax machine.
under a directiveas a result of a directive dưới chỉ thị của
Under an EC directive unleaded petrol must be made available throughout Britain.

children.name: decree
children.definition: an official order which has the effect of a law and is made by sb such as a king, queen, or military government: nghị định, sắc lệnh, chiếu chỉ

children.name: issue a decreesend out a decree ra một sắc lệnh, chiếu chỉ
examples: The Emperor issued the decree repealing martial law.
In 1637 the Emperor issued a decree ordering all foreigners to leave the country.

children.name: by decreeby making decrees bằng chiếu chỉ
examples: The king dissolved parliament and ruled by decree.

children.name: to give orders in a rude way
order around
children.definition: order sb around/aboutUK  if sb orders youaround or orders you about, they keep telling you what to do in an annoying or unfair way, and they seem to enjoy it: sai vặt, sai việc ai đó
examples: You won’t get the best out of your staff by ordering them around like that.
I wish you’d stop ordering me about -- I’m not your servant you know.

children.name: push around
children.definition: push sb around to order sb to do things in a rude, impatient, and often threatening way: bắt ép, ép buộc
examples: I’m sick and tired of being pushed around by him.
You shouldn’t let other people push you around - you’ve got to stand up for yourself.

children.name: lay down the law
children.definition: to tell people what they should do in an annoying way because you enjoy giving orders and think that you are always right: diễu võ giương oai
examples: If Bob starts laying down the law, just tell him to shut up.

children.name: throw your weight around
children.definition: to use your position of authority to tell other people what to do, in an unreasonable way: hống hách, hách dịch
examples: She likes to throw her weight around - it makes her feel important.
Why is everyone so upset? Has George been throwing his weight around again?

children.name: boss around
children.definition: boss sb around/ aboutUK  to keep giving sb orders in an annoying way, even though you have no authority to do so:
examples: My brother’s always bossing me around and making me clean up after him.
She’s a strong-minded woman -- she doesn’t let anyone boss her around.

children.name: ways to say: been ordered to do sth
on sb’s orders
children.definition: /instructions if you do sth on sb’s orders, or on sb’s instructions, you do it because they have officially told you to do it: dưới lệnh, chỉ thị của ai đó
examples: On the instructions of the new military government, soldiers burned books and other documents.

children.name: acting on somebody’s orders/instructionsdoing what someone has told you to do làm việc gì dưới lệnh, chỉ thị của ai đó
examples: Sergeant Dean claims that he was acting on the orders of the police chief.

children.name: under orders
children.definition: / instructions if sb is under orders or under instructions to do something, they have been officially ordered to do it as part of their duty by the person they are working for: theo lệnh, chỉ thị

children.name: under orders/instructions to do sth
examples: I am under instructions not to tell you the name of the person who has sent you the money.
The soldiers are under strict orders to abide by the ceasefire.

children.name: acting under orders/instructions
examples: State troopers acting under orders from the Mayor of Los Angeles have put down the riots.

children.name: at sb’s insistence
children.definition: if you do sth at sb’s insistence, you do it because they have firmly and repeatedly said that you must, even though you may not want to: làm việc theo sự sai khiến của ai
examples: At Joanna’s insistence we stayed the night at her house.
I took a local guide with me at the insistence of the government authorities.

children.name: to tell sb to do sth
expect
children.definition: to demand that sb does sth because it is a duty or seems reasonable :

children.name: expect sth from sb
examples: The officer expects complete obedience from his troops.

children.name: expect sb to do sth
examples: I can’t expect her to be on time if I’m late myself.

children.name: expect a lot of sb/expect too much of sb(= think sb can do more than may be possible )
examples: The school expects a lot of its students.

children.name: tell
children.definition: to say to someone that they must do something : ra lệnh, bảo
examples: ‘Wait here!’ he told the children.

children.name: tell sb to do sth
examples: The teacher told us to be quiet.
I thought I told you to be in bed by 10 o'clock!
She told him not to phone her again.

children.name: tell sb (that)
examples: The doctors have told me that I should give up smoking.

children.name: tell sb how/what/where etc
examples: Don’t tell me how to behave in public!
I’m in charge here, and I’m not going to have anyone telling me what to do.

children.name: do as you are toldused to tell children to obey làm như lời được bảo
examples: Do as you’re told and go and wash your hands.

children.name: order
children.definition: to tell sb to do sth in a threatening way: ra lệnh
examples: ‘Don’t move’, he ordered.

children.name: order sb to do sth
examples: A man with a gun ordered the woman to give him all her money.
He was ordered to pay £4000 towards the court costs of £10,000.

children.name: order sb out of/into/back etc
examples: She pointed her gun at him, ordering him out of the room.

children.name: ask
children.definition: sb to do sth to tell sb politely but firmly to do sth or to stop doing sth: yêu cầu ai đó làm gì
examples: Mr Evans, I must ask you to come with me to the police station.
Would you ask visitors not to park their cars in front of the entrance.

children.name: insist
children.definition: /ɪnˈsɪst/  to tell someone firmly and repeatedly that they must do something, especially something that they do not want to do: năn nỉ, nài nỉ
examples: ▪ I didn’t want to tell dad about the fight, but he insisted
insist (that)
▪ I wanted to pay by cheque but the landlord insisted that I pay him in cash.
▪ They’re insisting we report the matter to the police right away.

children.name: dictate
children.definition: to tell sb exactly what they must do or how they must behave : bắt buộc, ép buộc

children.name: dictate to
examples: The media cannot be allowed to dictate to the government.
She refused to be dictated to by some stupid official in Washington.

children.name: dictate who/what/how etc
examples: Can they dictate how the money will be spent?
Federal funds have to be usedas dictated byWashington.

children.name: dictate that
examples: Islamic custom dictates that women should be fully covered.
The US government attempted todictate the termsof the agreement.

children.name: call for sth
children.definition: —phrasal verbwithcall/ kɔːl / / kɑːl /verb
examples: C2 to demand that something happens:
Members have called for his resignation.

children.name: orders are orders
children.definition: said when you have to do something because someone in authority has told you to, and usually when you do not really approve of it mệnh lệnh là mệnh lệnh
examples: Nobody wants to do it, but orders are orders, so let's start.
